Aug
28
2019
Uncategorized
The event production industry has been forever changed with the creation of 3D Projection Mapping. Modern technology now allows projection mapping to transform a plain surface from the side of a building, or inside of a convention center, into a wall of amazement.
But what is 3D Projection Mapping?
3D Projection Mapping is the projection of 3D images and video onto nearly any surface. These images can be as complex as entire skyline or as simple as a logo. The use of this technology has changed the way event coordinators can change the ambiance of an event. 3D Projection Mapping is designed to wrap around specific physical features of the surface, turning the objects into interactive 3D displays.
How Does Projection Mapping Work?
By using a pre-production process during which images are fitted onto a 3D graphic rendering of the building, the same objects appear to wrap themselves around the physical features of any structure. They give the appearance of being painted on and part of the same structure. This can be done on a smaller scale to project 3D images on anything from a person in a window or a car changing their color, appearance and structure.
Thinking of launching a new product or hosting a party? Let our creative team come up with some renderings to project at your next event! 3D Projection Mapping is huge in advertising and promotions, because of its interactive nature. From dogs running on a wall, to dancing butterflies. Projection mapping is completely changing the way we view our surroundings. Projection Mapping has evolved since its debut nearly 20 years ago when it was used to project visuals and enhance live-music shows. It is now used by production companies, such as Light Up The Night to amplify our events, by using animated visuals and music to produce cinema style action and narratives. Projection mapping can turn buildings, walls, floors and even common objects into something truly magical. Contact Light Up The Night for a free consultation about our 3D Projection services!
Category:
Uncategorized
By
LIGHT UP THE NIGHT LLC
August 28, 2019

Event Lighting
You are here:
Home
Project
Event Lighting
Row Backgrounds
We Use Top Industry Event LED Lighting
As you can tell by our name, Light Up The Night, lighting is our specialty. From our LED Robots to event LED lighting, we know what it takes to get an event lit. Without lighting, a room is just a room, but with LED lighting, it’s turned into a private world for just you and your attendees.
t’s a world of vibrant colors and exotic patterns. Lighting serves to enhance your venue and décor or create focal points for specific areas or pieces. From our LED uplights — the most popular event request — to our moving strobes, we have everything you’ll need. We use state-of-the art LED lighting technology programmed to light up to the rhythm of your party. No matter what your goal is we can create, design, build and complete the project for you!
LED Uplights
Wash Lighting
Outdoor Lighting
Pinspot Lighting
Stage Lighting
Gobos Lighting
Bistro Lighting
Lighting Effects
Got Questions?
We got Answers! Contact us if you have specific questions about your event.
What type of lighting do you use?
Depending on the Event, we use a variety of LED lighting
How far do you travel?
We are a nationwide production company and travel anywhere in the US to bring ideas to life.
Are you licensed and insured?
Yes, we are fully licensed and insured.
Bistro Lighting
What is bistro lighting for an event? Bistro lights are decorative string lights that are used outdoor or indoor space. They provide light and beautiful energy across the room and enhances the space. Wedding lights for receptions and night time events, patio, and any gathering spots that require a fun and cool lighting.

Principles Of Our Work
The LUTN team is passionate about what we do. Our unparalleled enthusiasm helps create the fun, lively culture that is important at any spectacular event.
We provide creative, production, and technology solutions that delight audiences. From rigging support to an entire suite of audio-visual offerings, a partnership with LUTN provides you with the equipment and skills to support multiple types of events at your venue.
Our production team can also assist with more complex concert and other custom venue needs. With spectacular custom stage sets and the latest technology, we’ll help you design and deliver extraordinary experiences.
Creativity
Our skilled designers have creative minds to take each project to the next level

Frequently Asked Questions
How far do you travel?
We are a nationwide production company and travel anywhere in the US to bring ideas to life.
Are you licensed and insured?
Yes, we are fully licensed and insured.
Do I need to provide my own designs?
Pre-made designs are always an option. However, we have a very experienced and skilled in-house design team that can bring your visions to reality. Whether that be a logo or 3D rendering, our team will take your requests and create high quality designs from scratch.
Do you provide On-site/Day Of Staff?
Yes. Depending on your event’s needs we can provide onsite technicians, logistics managers, and project managers for the day of your event.
Am I responsible for transporting products provided by LUTN?
We have our own trucking transportation. You provide the where and when, we’ll take care of the how.

Aug
15
2019
Types of Lighting
You know that warm, fuzzy feeling while being captivated by the colors of a sunset, or those dull and depressing emotions while walking down the street during the darker seasons of the year? Well warm colors such as red, yellow and orange invoke excitement and attract your attention, whereas lack of colors can induce a sensation of depression and lethargy.
Light Up The Night is often asked what color should be used for an event. While choice of color may be about personal preference or representation of a brand, we believe that there is more to it than just being pleasant to look at. We question and study the thinking behind color, the feelings invoked, and what colors help open and stimulate our senses. As an event production company, we understand the psychology of color. Usually, when hosting a private party, people will choose their favorite color or colors. But when it comes to planning a corporate event or a festival, event managers often do not have a specific theme… This is where Team Light Up The Night comes into play.
The psychology of color has been pondered since the days of Sir Isaac Newton and his discovery of light refraction. Through his discovery, the concept of complementary colors was formed. Complementary colors are pairings of colors which are diametrically opposite on the color wheel, these colors emphasize the qualities of each other with red complementing green, and blue with yellow. Our sensations are exemplified when these pairings appear together, for instance blue and yellow heighten each other as seen above in van Gogh’s painting
Cafe Terrace on the Place du Forum.
The Breakdown of Color
The following colors
often emit the listed emotions:
Blue:
Security/integrity
     or tranquility/peace
Green:
Freshness/ environmental
Yellow:
Energy/cheerfulness
     or caution
Pink:
Romance,
     beauty, love, or sensitivity
Red:
Energy/passion
     or danger/war
Here at Light Up The Night, our creative team has studied the psychology of color for years giving us the insight and expertise to effectively design events. We will spend the necessary time planning and designing your event. Our
LED lighting
will contrast every small detail, while radiating the desired energy. Professional stage lighting is an essential factor when planning your event, and we’ve got you covered. Whether you want your dress to pop with the proper up-lights or want to emphasize your logo at your next
corporate event
, Light Up The Night will make it happen without a hitch!
Call today for a free consultation.
